item.title: By: dave
item.dc:creator: dave
item.content:encoded:
Yeah MJ, we have the same system here. And try as I might they wont be budged on this.

My coments being that if every thing failed on this site we could just switch to a replicated of log shiped dr server.

There coments being, we if every thing failed here we would have no app servers any way, so would need to rebuild the whole thing off site any way.

item.title: By: mj
item.dc:creator: mj
item.content:encoded:
When I was asked to setup write a DR plan I reviewed the Microsoft Best Practices and wrote it up.

I was unprepared when the system administrators informed me that they were not interested in mirroring and instead were going to utilize SAN replication and snapshots to replicate data.

The DR site would be available by using an alias which will point to the source site (ServerName, ip_address1, subnet_1) and (ServerName, ip_address1, subnet_2).

The was the first I had ever heard of this solution. Has anyone else had any experience like this?

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
Thanks! This model as served me well for a lot of years. Always seems easier to plan on levels like this.

The cloud changed a lot of things with DR. To me it’s application for DR is the strong points of the cloud. The type of data being secured makes a huge difference in the concepts but can really make for a cost advantage for DR
